H0.text: An organ is the most basic level of organization in the human body that Miranda learned about while studying how the human body carries out life functions.

H1.text: A system is the most basic level of organization in the human body for carrying out life functions, as Miranda learned.

H2.text: A tissue is the most basic level of organization in the human body, which Miranda learned about when studying how the human body carries out life functions.

H3.text: A cell is the most basic level of organization in the human body, as Miranda learned that it is the foundation for how the human body carries out life functions.

A4.text: The traditional hierarchy of biological organization extends from atoms to biospheres, with each level's functions being emergent properties not present in lower levels.

A5.text: Biological organization is defined as the arrangement of complex structures and systems using a reductionistic approach, implying that higher levels depend on the existence of lower levels.

A6.text: organization within the biosphere (in Ecology) at Wikibooks

A7.text: The cell is the basic structural and functional unit of all forms of life or organisms.

A8.text: The human body is composed of many different types of人民网 that together create tissues and subsequently organs and then organ systems.

A9.text: Tissues occupy a biological organizational level between cells and a complete organ.

A10.text: Organs are formed by the functional grouping together of multiple tissues.
